abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental impact assessment for
            the Mongolia Urban Services Rehabilitation Project Phase 2
            concludes that a new sanitary engineered landfill located at
            Moringiin Davaa is the most environmentally sustainable
            option for solid waste disposal for the Municipality of
            Ulaanbaatar. The facility would replace three existing
            landfill operations. Potential environmental impacts
            include: a) soil erosion /silt runoff - mitigated by
            restoration of soil, placement of hay bales, and erection of
            concrete rock works; b) air pollution from landfill gas -
            remaining within acceptable levels; c) increased traffic
            generation - only to occur during working hours; d) noise -
            this will increase during construction; e) visual amenity -
            minimal as the site would be buried f) water quality -
            negligible impact; g) dust and odor - mitigated by daily
            monitoring, watering the area, and ensuring that latrine
            operation is sanitary; and h) flora and fauna - impacts will
            be insignificant.
